answers.answer: You mention something's been done for the endo, PCOS, and diabetes.  What about the thyroid?  Without proper thyroid levels (can take quite some time to get this fixed), you will be unable to conceive/carry a pregnancy.Since you were pre-diabetes, you could make some changes to your diet and exercise habits which would possibly make the diabetes go away (Depending on the type) as well as help prepare you for eating habits you should maintain through pregnancy.The PCOS and endo may make it difficult to get pregnant, but without being your doctor, it's going to be impossible for me to say the extent of difficulty your particular case would present.

question: My husband and I have been trying for almost 5 years now to get pregnant. Misscarried in august of 2012 at 7 wks, afterwards found a series of complications...was diagnosed with Polycystic ovarian syndrome, pre-boarderline diabetes, boarder line thyroid disease and endometriosis. Dr said I miscarried bc of the PCOS, had surgery for the endometriosis, on meds for the diabetes & PCOS, had several u/s done, a couple biopsies done...and I'm exhausted? Will I EVER be able to have kids? Tired of going for test after test after test :( feeling defeated...
title: too many tests...frustrated...
